HDG.LOG.content: Heraclitus: en does/does not want to be called by name Zeus [can’t we say the same for Being?]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: Heraclitus: en does/does not want to be called by name Zeus [can’t we say the same for Being?]

HDG.LOG.content: en as Zeus [as legein?] [?] > [Zeus: highest present being—not Being???] > to name, to call forward, that which is laid down/gathered in name comes to light [Zeus as the dispatcher, lightning bolt as sending, of gathering]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: en as Zeus [as legein?] [?] > [Zeus: highest present being—not Being???] > to name, to call forward, that which is laid down/gathered in name comes to light [Zeus as the dispatcher, lightning bolt as sending, of gathering]

HDG.LOG.content: what happens when Being of beings, their distinction, is brought to language? [name of Being] > “bring to language”: secure Being in essence of language [never secure, returntocinder]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: what happens when Being of beings, their distinction, is brought to language? [name of Being] > “bring to language”: secure Being in essence of language [never secure, returntocinder]

HDG.IM.content: emptiness of word “Being,” complete withering of its naming force, not just particular case of general abuse of language: the destroyed relation to Being as such [the name?] is real ground for whole misrelation to language [how do you know this if you haven’t answered Nietzsche yet?] [if it is exemplary, what does the particular name matter?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: emptiness of word “Being,” complete withering of its naming force, not just particular case of general abuse of language: the destroyed relation to Being as such [the name?] is real ground for whole misrelation to language [how do you know this if you haven’t answered Nietzsche yet?] [if it is exemplary, what does the particular name matter?]

HDG.BC.content: Greeks as the earliest: originality/bindingness for our history, impending historical decisions: we name the “earliest” the incipient (das Anfängliche) > remembrance of inception can transport us into essential [many/herd misconstrues essential power, fails to hear]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Greeks as the earliest: originality/bindingness for our history, impending historical decisions: we name the “earliest” the incipient (das Anfängliche) > remembrance of inception can transport us into essential [many/herd misconstrues essential power, fails to hear]

HDG.BC.content: via Nietzsche, soldier and worker determine the actual [MOP], unique fusion: “type of humanity taken as measure by the present world-convulsion (Welterschütterung) [epoch] for its fulfillment (Vollzug),” metaphysical titles that name form of human fulfillment of being of beings now manifest, presciently called “will to power” [but it is not epochal for Nietzsche] [Heidegger on the sly]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: via Nietzsche, soldier and worker determine the actual [MOP], unique fusion: “type of humanity taken as measure by the present world-convulsion (Welterschütterung) [epoch] for its fulfillment (Vollzug),” metaphysical titles that name form of human fulfillment of being of beings now manifest, presciently called “will to power” [but it is not epochal for Nietzsche] [Heidegger on the sly]

HDG.BC.content: we 1st depend on beings because released into beings, this dependence put into word, pervasive in “is,” “are”: in each “tense-word” of language we name being [“is” method] > Being said w/ every word, verbal articulation—if not named each time w/ its own name [?] > Being as pre-giving of what 1st permits naming of beings (not addition (Zugabe)/supplement (Beigabe) [cf. Derrida])
HDG.BC.linkedContent: we 1st depend on beings because released into beings, this dependence put into word, pervasive in “is,” “are”: in each “tense-word” of language we name being [“is” method] > Being said w/ every word, verbal articulation—if not named each time w/ its own name [?] > Being as pre-giving of what 1st permits naming of beings (not addition (Zugabe)/supplement (Beigabe) [cf. Derrida])

HDG.BC.content: does most said in saying keep its essence secret? [why name Being?], Being keeps its essence silent, as silence, origin of language > the animal doesn’t speak: silence is impossible for it > language stands in essential relation to uniqueness of Being [Being needs man]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: does most said in saying keep its essence secret? [why name Being?], Being keeps its essence silent, as silence, origin of language > the animal doesn’t speak: silence is impossible for it > language stands in essential relation to uniqueness of Being [Being needs man]

HDG.BC.content: in the casting away & toward us don’t wish to capture what opens up in a formal schema of formal thinking [does name Being remain formal???] > impasse stems from Being itself? guidewords indicate a peculiar ambivalence of Being
HDG.BC.linkedContent: in the casting away & toward us don’t wish to capture what opens up in a formal schema of formal thinking [does name Being remain formal???] > impasse stems from Being itself? guidewords indicate a peculiar ambivalence of Being

HDG.BC.content: relinquishing thought most deplorable way for thought to accomplish task [re: refusing to rely on “paradox”]: give up question of Being as pseudoquestion, or acknowledge exposed impasse (“aporia”) (must come to terms w/ it in some way) [how to treat Derrida’s aporia?] > impasse that Being brings w/ it is its mark of distinction (eigene Auszeichnung)[mark prior to Being? differance] > acc. Heidegger, to call impasse (Ausweglosigkeit) “aporia” is to close eyes at impasse [?] [Heidegger beyond Derrida?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: relinquishing thought most deplorable way for thought to accomplish task [re: refusing to rely on “paradox”]: give up question of Being as pseudoquestion, or acknowledge exposed impasse (“aporia”) (must come to terms w/ it in some way) [how to treat Derrida’s aporia?] > impasse that Being brings w/ it is its mark of distinction (eigene Auszeichnung)[mark prior to Being? differance] > acc. Heidegger, to call impasse (Ausweglosigkeit) “aporia” is to close eyes at impasse [?] [Heidegger beyond Derrida?]

HDG.BC.content: Being withdraws from us when we say it > “Being has singularly burst open our human essence” > “we belong to Being, and yet not” >  homeless in our ownmost homeland, not directly allowed in—assuming we may thus name our own essence
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Being withdraws from us when we say it > “Being has singularly burst open our human essence” > “we belong to Being, and yet not” > homeless in our ownmost homeland, not directly allowed in—assuming we may thus name our own essence

HDG.TB.content: [Augustine] beginning of Western thinking, Being is thought, not as “It gives” as such, latter withdraws in favor of gift which it gives > giving which gives only its gift, in giving holds itself back and withdraws, such a giving we call sending [lookup] > Being—that which It gives—is what is sent [other names for Being]
HDG.TB.linkedContent: [Augustine] beginning of Western thinking, Being is thought, not as “It gives” as such, latter withdraws in favor of gift which it gives > giving which gives only its gift, in giving holds itself back and withdraws, such a giving we call sending [lookup] > Being—that which It gives—is what is sent [other names for Being]

HDG.IWM.content: at stake: attentiveness (Achten) to arrival (Ankunft) of hitherto unspoken essence of unconcealedness Being has announced (angekündigt) itself to be [cf. 280n X Being, also Being, truth, world, Ereignis] [multiple names]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: at stake: attentiveness (Achten) to arrival (Ankunft) of hitherto unspoken essence of unconcealedness Being has announced (angekündigt) itself to be [cf. 280n X Being, also Being, truth, world, Ereignis] [multiple names]

HDG.IWM.content: Dasein names that which is 1st of all to be experienced, subsequently thought accordingly as a place (Stelle), locality (Ortschaft) of truth of Being
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: Dasein names that which is 1st of all to be experienced, subsequently thought accordingly as a place (Stelle), locality (Ortschaft) of truth of Being

HDG.IWM.content: “time” as preliminary name (Vorname) for truth of Being, truth is what prevails as essential in Being, is Being itself
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: “time” as preliminary name (Vorname) for truth of Being, truth is what prevails as essential in Being, is Being itself

HDG.IWM.content: if we adhere to customary usage (of words for Being: einai, esse) betray ourselves as pacemakers (Schrittmacher) of greatest thoughtlessness to have gained currency in human thought, has remained dominant until this moment > essence of presencing deeply concealed in early names for Being
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: if we adhere to customary usage (of words for Being: einai, esse) betray ourselves as pacemakers (Schrittmacher) of greatest thoughtlessness to have gained currency in human thought, has remained dominant until this moment > essence of presencing deeply concealed in early names for Being

HDG.IWM.content: via time as preliminary name Being is unconcealed, concealed essence of time speaks in first metaphysical names for Being & in its last name: “eternal recurrence of the same” [EROS] [is Being a metaphysical name for Being?]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: via time as preliminary name Being is unconcealed, concealed essence of time speaks in first metaphysical names for Being & in its last name: “eternal recurrence of the same” [EROS] [is Being a metaphysical name for Being?]

HDG.QB.content: presencing (“being”) always presencing directed toward human essence, presencing as a call (Geheiss) that calls upon human essence > human essence as such is a hearing, belongs to calling of this call, the approach of presencing > that which is the Same (“being”?) each time: belonging together of call & hearing—“What am I saying? It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: presencing (“being”) always presencing directed toward human essence, presencing as a call (Geheiss) that calls upon human essence > human essence as such is a hearing, belongs to calling of this call, the approach of presencing > that which is the Same (“being”?) each time: belonging together of call & hearing—“What am I saying? It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]

HDG.QB.content: essence of nihilism worthy of thought: the Saying of thinking (we name it awkwardly enough), the Saying is thinking itself
HDG.QB.linkedContent: essence of nihilism worthy of thought: the Saying of thinking (we name it awkwardly enough), the Saying is thinking itself

HDG.FS.content: Heraclitus’ Fragment 72 names humans and their “departure from being (Abkommen vom Sein)” (cf. Being and Time), designates a fall upon/away/from beings (Verfall oder Ab-fall [an das Seinde]) > this fall belongs to Difference (Unterschied) btwn Being/beings, so that Fall of Man sets aside [obscures] this difference > for Heraclitus, the foreign depart from difference [not as antagonistically (feindlich) disposed toward foreign (Fremden) as Plato]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heraclitus’ Fragment 72 names humans and their “departure from being (Abkommen vom Sein)” (cf. Being and Time), designates a fall upon/away/from beings (Verfall oder Ab-fall [an das Seinde]) > this fall belongs to Difference (Unterschied) btwn Being/beings, so that Fall of Man sets aside [obscures] this difference > for Heraclitus, the foreign depart from difference [not as antagonistically (feindlich) disposed toward foreign (Fremden) as Plato]

HDG.FS.content: Heraclitus doesn’t combine opposites [dialectic], he names diapheromenon as sympheromenon > [fragment 50] human thinking, its noein, belongs to logos, determines itself (from this) as omologein
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heraclitus doesn’t combine opposites [dialectic], he names diapheromenon as sympheromenon > [fragment 50] human thinking, its noein, belongs to logos, determines itself (from this) as omologein

HDG.FS.content: what is the Same in which day passes to night? the en, the unity, other name for Being? world, light, space, time, etc.—all too general (allgemeinen)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: what is the Same in which day passes to night? the en, the unity, other name for Being? world, light, space, time, etc.—all too general (allgemeinen)

HDG.FS.content: Plato names eidōlon as mē on (“un-being”), distinguishes from ouk on, sheer non-being [cf. pp. 39, 42] > eidōlon also distinguished from eidos, that which shows itself, what one sees > but one can’t reach eidos w/out eidōlon, table obscured by wood of which it’s made > Aristotle brings Ideas back to earth, eidos becomes morphē of a tode ti in motion/rest: kinēsis (and for Aristotle all moves) defined as energeai (entelecheia), thus energeia highest determination of being
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Plato names eidōlon as mē on (“un-being”), distinguishes from ouk on, sheer non-being [cf. pp. 39, 42] > eidōlon also distinguished from eidos, that which shows itself, what one sees > but one can’t reach eidos w/out eidōlon, table obscured by wood of which it’s made > Aristotle brings Ideas back to earth, eidos becomes morphē of a tode ti in motion/rest: kinēsis (and for Aristotle all moves) defined as energeai (entelecheia), thus energeia highest determination of being

HDG.FS.content: distinguish pure nomination (onomazein) from making a proposition (legein ti kata tinos) > simple nomination (Nennung): one who names intervenes only to step into background before being, being is pure phenomenon > proposition (Aussage): one who makes proposition takes part, ranges over being in order to speak about it, being is only upokeimenon then, name only a residue (Rest) of apophansis
HDG.FS.linkedContent: distinguish pure nomination (onomazein) from making a proposition (legein ti kata tinos) > simple nomination (Nennung): one who names intervenes only to step into background before being, being is pure phenomenon > proposition (Aussage): one who makes proposition takes part, ranges over being in order to speak about it, being is only upokeimenon then, name only a residue (Rest) of apophansis

HDG.FS.content: correspondence (Entsprechung) of Parmenidean to auto and Heraclitus’ logos: both name that gathering in which being makes its address (zuspricht)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: correspondence (Entsprechung) of Parmenidean to auto and Heraclitus’ logos: both name that gathering in which being makes its address (zuspricht)

HDG.FS.content: for Hölderlin, to name is to call (Rufen), not to make a proposition > [unpoetic nature of Greek interpretation of language exposed, no higher poetry than in Greece!] > conception of saying (Sagens) as proposition (Aussagen) prevents access to essence of poetry
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Hölderlin, to name is to call (Rufen), not to make a proposition > [unpoetic nature of Greek interpretation of language exposed, no higher poetry than in Greece!] > conception of saying (Sagens) as proposition (Aussagen) prevents access to essence of poetry

HDG.FS.content: [Heidegger quotes himself, discusses possibility of using same names inside/outside metaphysics (paleonym)] Humboldt: old coin w/ new conveyance
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [Heidegger quotes himself, discusses possibility of using same names inside/outside metaphysics (paleonym)] Humboldt: old coin w/ new conveyance

HDG.FS.content: nothing characterizes being: ontological proposition > when nothing & its negating aren’t understood negatively, being is something entirely other (etwas ganz und gar Anders) than a being > participle “nihilating (nichtend)” as determinate activity of being, durch die allein das Seiende ist > name it an origin if all ontic-causal overtones are excluded [possible?]: Ereignis of Being as condition for arrival (Ankunft) of beings: das Sein lasst das Seinde anwesen [factical life]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: nothing characterizes being: ontological proposition > when nothing & its negating aren’t understood negatively, being is something entirely other (etwas ganz und gar Anders) than a being > participle “nihilating (nichtend)” as determinate activity of being, durch die allein das Seiende ist > name it an origin if all ontic-causal overtones are excluded [possible?]: Ereignis of Being as condition for arrival (Ankunft) of beings: das Sein lasst das Seinde anwesen [factical life]

HDG.FS.content: when attention is drawn to the presencing (das Anwesen) of “letting-be,” this interpretation that of metaphysics [doesn’t Heidegger interpret as such in Anaximander?] > in emphasis (Betonung) on presencing, a 3rd has its place (Ort), the stress (Ton) now on letting itself, that which allows (lässt) (releases [entlässt]?) presencing, allows Being, the epochē of Being: one stands before being as being, not a form (Gestalten) of its destiny [so close to Hegel] > in emphasis to let presencing, no longer room for name Being, letting is pure giving, the it (das Es) that gives, Ereignis [beyond Being]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: when attention is drawn to the presencing (das Anwesen) of “letting-be,” this interpretation that of metaphysics [doesn’t Heidegger interpret as such in Anaximander?] > in emphasis (Betonung) on presencing, a 3rd has its place (Ort), the stress (Ton) now on letting itself, that which allows (lässt) (releases [entlässt]?) presencing, allows Being, the epochē of Being: one stands before being as being, not a form (Gestalten) of its destiny [so close to Hegel] > in emphasis to let presencing, no longer room for name Being, letting is pure giving, the it (das Es) that gives, Ereignis [beyond Being]

HDG.FS.content: can man bring about all these imperatives & could he break them himself? Marxism & sociology name the “imperatives”—to which we are compelled today > Heidegger gathers then in name Ge-stell, most extreme form of history of metaphysics, of the destiny of being, from epoch of objectivity to orderability, no longer objects only “consumer goods” at disposal of every consumer [w/out objectivity, is there no more consciousness?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: can man bring about all these imperatives & could he break them himself? Marxism & sociology name the “imperatives”—to which we are compelled today > Heidegger gathers then in name Ge-stell, most extreme form of history of metaphysics, of the destiny of being, from epoch of objectivity to orderability, no longer objects only “consumer goods” at disposal of every consumer [w/out objectivity, is there no more consciousness?]

HDG.FS.content: in Greek manner, einai means to presence (Greeks speak more revealingly (zeigender)/precisely than we do) [Heidegger’s bias?] > Parmenides’ esti gar einai, genuine tautology: names Same only once, as itself: [fragment 8] “the same dwelling in the same, it lies in itself” [cf. 80 verse is eukuklos, abundant/overflowing, says on its own complete tautology] > in domain of inapparent (Unscheinbaren): presencing itself presences (anwest Anwesen selbst): “great number of indications (Zeignisse) [marks? traces?]…”, indication as sēma, what shows & lets be seen
HDG.FS.linkedContent: in Greek manner, einai means to presence (Greeks speak more revealingly (zeigender)/precisely than we do) [Heidegger’s bias?] > Parmenides’ esti gar einai, genuine tautology: names Same only once, as itself: [fragment 8] “the same dwelling in the same, it lies in itself” [cf. 80 verse is eukuklos, abundant/overflowing, says on its own complete tautology] > in domain of inapparent (Unscheinbaren): presencing itself presences (anwest Anwesen selbst): “great number of indications (Zeignisse) [marks? traces?]…”, indication as sēma, what shows & lets be seen

HDG.CCP.content: [Heidegger’s method of giving word new meaning, e.g. the region, so it names something else]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: [Heidegger’s method of giving word new meaning, e.g. the region, so it names something else]

HDG.CCP.content: how movement comes from rest suddenly clearer to me > scientist causes great embarrassment, asking: “how far is it really Gelassenheit into which I tried to let myself?” > what we designate w/ a word doesn’t have that word hanging on it (like a name plate) > whatever we name has been nameless before > how can we decide the adequacy of a name? or is all designation arbitrary? > is there the nameless at all? or does the name not occur to us? > p. 71 perhaps names are not the result of designation but the occurring together of the nameable, name, & named (nature of words)
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: how movement comes from rest suddenly clearer to me > scientist causes great embarrassment, asking: “how far is it really Gelassenheit into which I tried to let myself?” > what we designate w/ a word doesn’t have that word hanging on it (like a name plate) > whatever we name has been nameless before > how can we decide the adequacy of a name? or is all designation arbitrary? > is there the nameless at all? or does the name not occur to us? > p. 71 perhaps names are not the result of designation but the occurring together of the nameable, name, & named (nature of words)

HDG.CCP.content: Heraclitus’ agchibasiē: “going near,” “letting-oneself-into-nearness,” “moving into nearness,” the name/best name for what we’ve found?
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: Heraclitus’ agchibasiē: “going near,” “letting-oneself-into-nearness,” “moving into nearness,” the name/best name for what we’ve found?

HDG.DL.content: confusion [nihilistic reading of Heidegger] re: name “Being,” because belongs to patrimony (Eigentum) of Sprache of metaphysics > bring out essence of metaphysics: bring metaphysics w/in its own limits > overcoming metaphysics: neither destruction (Zerstörung) nor denial (Verleugnung) of metaphysics (intend anything else would be childish, demean history)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: confusion [nihilistic reading of Heidegger] re: name “Being,” because belongs to patrimony (Eigentum) of Sprache of metaphysics > bring out essence of metaphysics: bring metaphysics w/in its own limits > overcoming metaphysics: neither destruction (Zerstörung) nor denial (Verleugnung) of metaphysics (intend anything else would be childish, demean history)

HDG.DL.content: why did you not surrender (überliessen) name “Being?” give it its own name > how does one give a name to what he’s still searching for? > assign the naming word: constitutes finding
HDG.DL.linkedContent: why did you not surrender (überliessen) name “Being?” give it its own name > how does one give a name to what he’s still searching for? > assign the naming word: constitutes finding

HDG.DL.content: transformation (Verwandlung) of thinking occurs as a passage (Wanderung), one site left for another, sites placed in discussion (Erörterung), one site (Ort) is metaphysics, the other we leave w/out a name [overcoming metaphysics] > in leaving behind metaphysics, Heidegger leaves behind aesthetics grounded in metaphysics: in such a way that we can give thought to nature of aesthetics, direct it back (verweisen) w/in its boundaries
HDG.DL.linkedContent: transformation (Verwandlung) of thinking occurs as a passage (Wanderung), one site left for another, sites placed in discussion (Erörterung), one site (Ort) is metaphysics, the other we leave w/out a name [overcoming metaphysics] > in leaving behind metaphysics, Heidegger leaves behind aesthetics grounded in metaphysics: in such a way that we can give thought to nature of aesthetics, direct it back (verweisen) w/in its boundaries

HDG.DL.content: Koto: the happening holding sway (waltende Ereignen) > language as Koto ba: the petals (Blütenblätter) that stem from Koto > wondrous, names something other than Sprache, glossa, lingua, langue > Heidegger the inquirer prefers Sage, saying, probably means the same as “show (zeigen)”: let appear and let shine—but in the manner of hinting > Japaner has arrived home through beckoning hint of Koto ba
HDG.DL.linkedContent: Koto: the happening holding sway (waltende Ereignen) > language as Koto ba: the petals (Blütenblätter) that stem from Koto > wondrous, names something other than Sprache, glossa, lingua, langue > Heidegger the inquirer prefers Sage, saying, probably means the same as “show (zeigen)”: let appear and let shine—but in the manner of hinting > Japaner has arrived home through beckoning hint of Koto ba

HDG.LP.content: [finitude] soul called to die, to go under, Untergang, to leave the earth behind: not a catastrophe, not a mere withering decay (Verfall) > Der Schritt des Fremden goes away in the dusk/twilight (Dämmerung), not Untergang (destruction, twilight of end), Auch der Morgen dämmert, twilight also a rising (Aufgehen), night’s blue rises > Ghostly (Geistliche) twilights the blue, ghostly marks (kennzeichnet) the twilight
HDG.LP.linkedContent: [finitude] soul called to die, to go under, Untergang, to leave the earth behind: not a catastrophe, not a mere withering decay (Verfall) > Der Schritt des Fremden goes away in the dusk/twilight (Dämmerung), not Untergang (destruction, twilight of end), Auch der Morgen dämmert, twilight also a rising (Aufgehen), night’s blue rises > Ghostly (Geistliche) twilights the blue, ghostly marks (kennzeichnet) the twilight

HDG.LP.content: in Trakl, blue not an image to mark holy [symbol?], blue is the depth of the holy—because of its gathering > frozen rigor (Starre) of animal face not that of dead [rigor mortis], gathers into silent gaze (Aussehen) toward holy
HDG.LP.linkedContent: in Trakl, blue not an image to mark holy [symbol?], blue is the depth of the holy—because of its gathering > frozen rigor (Starre) of animal face not that of dead [rigor mortis], gathers into silent gaze (Aussehen) toward holy

HDG.LP.content: Trakl’s “blue wild game”: countering glance (Gegenblick) of human nature, thought of stranger’s steps, illumined by holy; “blue wild game”: names mortals who think of stranger, wander w/ him to home (Einheimische) of human being > they are few/unknown who begin such journey: what is of the essence occurs (ereignet) rarely, suddenly, in quiet [instant, event]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Trakl’s “blue wild game”: countering glance (Gegenblick) of human nature, thought of stranger’s steps, illumined by holy; “blue wild game”: names mortals who think of stranger, wander w/ him to home (Einheimische) of human being > they are few/unknown who begin such journey: what is of the essence occurs (ereignet) rarely, suddenly, in quiet [instant, event]

HDG.LP.content: apartness is active (west) as pure spirit, radiance of blue, kindles (entflammt) a stiller childhood into the gold of 1st beginning > Elis turns his golden countenance toward this earliness, his Gegenblick keeps/guards (wahrt) nocturnal flame of spirit of apartness [what hermeneutic circle names superficially, attention]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: apartness is active (west) as pure spirit, radiance of blue, kindles (entflammt) a stiller childhood into the gold of 1st beginning > Elis turns his golden countenance toward this earliness, his Gegenblick keeps/guards (wahrt) nocturnal flame of spirit of apartness [what hermeneutic circle names superficially, attention]

HDG.LP.content: Trakl silently sounds the mystery (Geheimnis) > the unity (Einheit) of “One Generation (Ein Geschlecht),” arises (entquillt) from the race (Schlag) that gathers along path of stranger, enfolds discord of generations into gentler two-fold > One of One Generation, not opposed to two but hidden unifying force [indifference point?] > Geschlecht names historical generation of man, mankind as distinct (Unterschied) from all other living creatures, names race, tribes, clans, families, & always refers to twofoldness of sexes
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Trakl silently sounds the mystery (Geheimnis) > the unity (Einheit) of “One Generation (Ein Geschlecht),” arises (entquillt) from the race (Schlag) that gathers along path of stranger, enfolds discord of generations into gentler two-fold > One of One Generation, not opposed to two but hidden unifying force [indifference point?] > Geschlecht names historical generation of man, mankind as distinct (Unterschied) from all other living creatures, names race, tribes, clans, families, & always refers to twofoldness of sexes

HDG.WL.content: ability to speak marks (zeichnet) man as man, this mark (Aus-Zeichnung) contains (enthält) the design (Aufriss) of man’s essence > language grants to man is foundation of human being, he can speak in terms of “it is” (often remains unspoken)
HDG.WL.linkedContent: ability to speak marks (zeichnet) man as man, this mark (Aus-Zeichnung) contains (enthält) the design (Aufriss) of man’s essence > language grants to man is foundation of human being, he can speak in terms of “it is” (often remains unspoken)

HDG.WL.content: diversity of elements in language, an original count (Zählen) not yet enumerable, a belonging together shows itself (ergab sich) > the count is a recounting that anticipates (auf vorblickt) the Einigende im Zusammengëhoren, but can’t make it appear > long history of inability to experience unifying unity of Sprachwesens, thus it remains w/out a name
HDG.WL.linkedContent: diversity of elements in language, an original count (Zählen) not yet enumerable, a belonging together shows itself (ergab sich) > the count is a recounting that anticipates (auf vorblickt) the Einigende im Zusammengëhoren, but can’t make it appear > long history of inability to experience unifying unity of Sprachwesens, thus it remains w/out a name

HDG.WL.content: Heidegger will call the unity of language: Aufriss (design rift), name demands we see proper of language’s essence more clearly > [English translator offers etymology of “sign” in design, Latin signum, secare, to cut] riss like ritzen (carve), to cut a furrow in soil, open to seed/growth > Auf-riss the whole of the traits (Züge) that structures & prevails throughout (durchfügt) the open/freedom of language > Aufriss the drawing/outline (Zeichnung) of language, structure (Gefüge) of a show/indication (Zeigens) in which speakers/speaking, spoken/unspoken, are joined (verfugt)
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Heidegger will call the unity of language: Aufriss (design rift), name demands we see proper of language’s essence more clearly > [English translator offers etymology of “sign” in design, Latin signum, secare, to cut] riss like ritzen (carve), to cut a furrow in soil, open to seed/growth > Auf-riss the whole of the traits (Züge) that structures & prevails throughout (durchfügt) the open/freedom of language > Aufriss the drawing/outline (Zeichnung) of language, structure (Gefüge) of a show/indication (Zeigens) in which speakers/speaking, spoken/unspoken, are joined (verfugt)

HDG.WL.content: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking

HDG.EC.content: this is all so simple & full of mystery, how could you know all this with such clarity since this morning? > in the simple experience (einfachen Erfahrung) of the coming, as that upon which we wait, what is healing draws near (naht), is granted (geworden) to us [so the experience is already the arrival?] > you say “to us” but it was only granted to you > I would like to share it now w/ you > my experience allows me to name for the you the wound beginning to heal, I was allowed/learned to presage (ahnen) [so priestly all this]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: this is all so simple & full of mystery, how could you know all this with such clarity since this morning? > in the simple experience (einfachen Erfahrung) of the coming, as that upon which we wait, what is healing draws near (naht), is granted (geworden) to us [so the experience is already the arrival?] > you say “to us” but it was only granted to you > I would like to share it now w/ you > my experience allows me to name for the you the wound beginning to heal, I was allowed/learned to presage (ahnen) [so priestly all this]

HDG.EC.content: the coming: that before (voraus) which nothing can be thought, the unprethinkable (das Unvordenkliche) [cf. Derrida to-come] > what heals can’t be set forth in propositional statements (in aussagenden Sätzen darstellen), but only conversationally surmised (gesprächsweise vermuten) [Derrida would say it can only be marked on the margins, nor would he call it what heals]

Derrida to-come] > what heals can’t be set forth in propositional statements (in aussagenden Sätzen darstellen), but only conversationally surmised (gesprächsweise vermuten) [Derrida would say it can only be marked on the margins, nor would he call it what heals]
